docs.title: Welcome to The Aegis Line
docs.text:
Lord Commander Lucien Drayke, final transmission

They are not just worlds. They are memories carved in stone. Warnings. Oaths. Graves. They are the Aegis Line.

Welcome, Commander

This site contains the custom campaign rules for the Aegis Line Crusade — a sector-wide Warhammer 40,000 narrative campaign set along the blood-soaked, storm-choked defenses of the Aegis Line.

Here, the ancient bastion-worlds stand as the last wall between the Imperium and annihilation. Heroes rise. Saints fall. Xenos, traitors, and daemons claw at the gates. And across it all, your forces march—under fire, beneath banners, toward glory or oblivion.

This campaign introduces several custom rulesets and relic systems designed to enhance strategic depth and narrative immersion. Key features include:

  • 📈 Campaign Scoring System based on territorial control and team objectives
  • 🗺️ Custom Relics such as the Drayk, Minean, and Slaughter relics, found through mission-specific conditions
  • 🛡️ Special Rules like Unbreakable, Voice of War, and Battle Hardened
  • ⚔️ Narrative-driven battle elements, including legendary objectives and world-specific events

Whether you serve the Imperium, Chaos or your own ambition, your decisions here will shape the fate of the Aegis Line.

Use the navigation menu to explore each section of the campaign rules in more detail.

Danger

The Line has held before. It must hold again.

docs.title: Campaign Scoring
docs.text: At the end of each campaign phase, each faction team earns Campaign Points based on how much territory they control on each planet.

docs.title: Scoring Rule
docs.text:
For every 30% of a planet a team controls, they earn 1 Campaign Point.

30% control = 1 Campaign Point 60% control = 2 Campaign Points 90% or more = 3 Campaign Points

docs.title: Team Agendas
docs.text: Teams may also earn additional Campaign Points by completing Team Agendas assigned during each phase.

docs.title: Blackstone Supremacy
docs.text: At the end of each Campaign Phase, the team that possesses the highest number of Blackstone Fragments is awarded 3 additional Campaign Points.

docs.title: Final Victory
docs.text: At the end of the third Campaign Phase, the team that has earned the most Campaign Points across all phases is declared the winner of the Aegis Line Campaign.

docs.title: Custom Warhammer 40,000 Crusade Campaign Overview
docs.text: Welcome to our custom Crusade campaign! Prepare to forge your warlord’s legend across escalating phases of brutal conflict. This campaign uses the Pariah Nexus Crusade rules for all in-game mechanics, with a few key custom rules outlined below:

docs.title: Starting Roster Guidelines
docs.text:
• Max Points: 1,200
  • Minimum Units: 2 Battleline units
  • Maximum Epic Hero: 1 (must not exceed 150 points)

Choose your force wisely — these are the warriors that will carve the first blood-soaked chapter of your Crusade!

docs.title: Campaign Progression & Army Growth
docs.text:
Your Crusade force will expand as the war intensifies. The following limits apply during each phase:

Campaign Phase Max Crusade Force Size Phase One 2,000 Points Phase Two 3,000 Points Phase Three 3,500 Points

You’ll have opportunities to add new units, upgrade existing ones, and adapt to the growing threats across the campaign.

Forge alliances, crush your foes, and leave your mark on the Pariah Nexus.

Let the war begin!

docs.title: Code of Conduct – The Honor of the Line
docs.text:
All players are expected to uphold the values of fair play, respect, and narrative-driven fun.

If a player is repeatedly reported for unsportsmanlike conduct, including but not limited to:

  • Rudeness or toxic behavior

  • Cheating or rules manipulation

  • Intentionally unfair lists or gameplay

  • Disrupting the spirit of the campaign

Then the Game Master may issue a Team Penalty.

Warning

The player’s team will lose 3 Campaign Points at the end of the phase.

Repeat offenses may lead to the player being suspended from further participation.

docs.title: Drayk Relic
docs.text:
Echoes of Determination

It was never the bullet that killed. It was the beam—the searing lance of heaven that followed the shot. Where the barrel turned, orbit burned.

docs.title: Fires from the Skies
docs.text:
Before setting up terrain, the players roll off.

The winner of the roll off rolls one D6:

  • On a 1–3, nothing happens.
  • On a 4–6, place three Lucien Drayk statues.

Place the statue within 12" of the centre of the battlefield.

The statues are treated as objective markers for the purposes of control. However, they do not generate any Victory Points through mission rules.

docs.title: End of Battle
docs.text:
At the end of the battle the player who controls more Lucien Drayk statues gains 2 Blackstone fragments. In addition, roll a D6. On a 4+ they gain a Drayk Relic.

Important

There are three Drayk Relics.

Once a Drayk Relic has been discovered on a specific planet of the Aegis Line, no further Drayk Relics can be discovered on that same planet for the remainder of the campaign.

Drayk Relics can be found on:

  • Pyran V
  • The Damorak Forge
  • Hekator

docs.title: Drayk Relics Found
docs.text:
• Pyran V
  • The Damorak Forge
  • Hekator

docs.title: Matchmaking & Campaign Scoring System
docs.text: At the beginning of each Campaign Phase, the Warmaster of each team allocates a number of Attack Tokens to determine where and how battles will take place. These battles are known as Conquest Battles.

docs.title: How Matchmaking Works
docs.text:
• At the start of a Campaign Phase, each team receives a limited number of Attack Tokens.
  • The team’s Warmaster decides how to distribute these tokens across the campaign map or battlefronts.
  • Each Attack Token represents an attempt to conquer a location, and results in a Conquest Battle against another team.

This system ensures strategic planning and coordinated assaults as each team fights to expand their influence and territory.

docs.title: Conquest Battles
docs.text:
• Each time a battle is fought due to an Attack Token, it is a Conquest Battle.
  • The outcome of these battles determines which team gains Campaign Points.

docs.title: Winning the Campaign
docs.text:
• Throughout the campaign, teams accumulate Campaign Points by winning Conquest Battles.
  • At the end of the final Campaign Phase, the team with the most Campaign Points is declared the winner of the campaign!

Prepare your forces, coordinate your attacks, and fight for total domination!

docs.title: Minean Relic
docs.text:
Echoes of Bravery

The blade does not choose a hero.

It chooses a purpose.

docs.title: The Blade of Minea
docs.text:
Before setting up terrain, the players roll off. The winner of the roll off rolls one D6:

  • On a 1–3, place a Damaged Statue of Castor Minea.
  • On a 4–6, place an Undamaged Statue of Castor Minea.

Place the statue within 12" of the centre of the battlefield.

The statue is treated as an objective marker for the purposes of control. However, it does not generate any Victory Points through mission rules.

docs.title: End of Battle
docs.text:
At the end of the battle, the player who controls the statue gains 2 Blackstone fragments. That player also rolls one D6. On a 5+, they gain a Minean Relic.

Important

There are four Minean Relics. Once a Minean Relic has been discovered on a specific planet of the Aegis Line, no further Minean Relics can be discovered on that same planet for the remainder of the campaign.

Minean Relics can be found on:

  • Bastion Thanovar
  • Vallak’s Spite, Gorgomire
  • Saint Alyssia’s Vigil.

docs.title: Minean Relics Found
docs.text:
• Bastion Thanovar
  • Vallak’s Spite
  • Gorgomire
  • Saint Alyssia’s Vigil

docs.title: Special Campaign Rules
docs.text: In this campaign, we are using the following special rules.

docs.title: Unbreakable
docs.text: Custom Characters never fail an Out of Action test.

docs.title: Voice of War
docs.text: Custom Characters must take part in every campaign battle.

docs.title: Battle Hardened
docs.text: Each unit may retain one Battle Trait of your choice, even if a rule, event, or effect would cause that unit to lose any or all of its Battle Traits.

docs.title: The Slaughter Relic
docs.text:
Echoes of Rage

It was not forged in fire, but in screams. Not tempered in steel, but in skulls. It will not rest until the galaxy kneels beneath it.

docs.title: The Slaughter Axe
docs.text:
Before setting up terrain, the players roll of. The winner of the roll off rolls one D6:

  • On a 1–3, nothing happens.
  • On a 4–6, set up a Blood Altar.

Place the Altar within 12" of the centre of the battlefield.

The Altar is treated as an objective marker for the purposes of control. However, it does not generate any Victory Points through mission rules.

docs.title: Create a Blood Altar Tally.
docs.text: Each time a player destroys an enemy unit, they add 1 point to their Blood Altar Tally If a player reaches 8 or more Blood Altar Tally points, the Blood Altar is awakened.

docs.title: End of Battle
docs.text:
At the end of the battle, the player who controls the Blood Altar gains 2 Blackstone Fragments.

If that player has 8 or more Blood Altar Tally points, they also receive a Slaughter Relic.

Important

There are eight Slaughter Relics. A maximum of two Slaughter Relics may be discovered on each planet of the Aegis Line during the campaign.

Once two Slaughter Relics have been found on a specific planet, no further Slaughter Relics can be discovered there for the remainder of the campaign.

Slaughter Relics may be found on the following worlds:

  • Bastion Thanovar
  • Vallak’s Spite
  • Gorgomire
  • Saint Alyssia’s Vigil
